title: Fix Windows boot time event
body: Since a Windows 10 release (I think version 1809), the boot time event is only created for a full shutdown/reboot - but most of the time Windows only goes to a new hibernation mode. Therefore no Event Id 100 (Boot Performance Monitoring) event is created anymore, which makes it hard to track whethter a boot took exceptionally long, etc... It would be nice if this event could be reinstated.
